B000002MG1|5.0|Automatic for the People is, quite simply, a masterpiece. It is my first (and so far, only) REM record, but it glows with such incredible emotion and depth that it should last anyone a long time. The album features a collection of magnificent alternative rock tracks - some are slow, quiet and haunting (Drive), some are sweet and poppy (Sidewinder Sleeps Tonite), some are bittersweet and moving (Everybody Hurts, Nightswimming), and some are deep and energetic (Ignoreland). But differences aside, every song adds up to make Automatic a fabulous collection of alternative rock. The overall mood of the record is melancholy but hopeful, with many songs containing heartfelt reflections, introspections, morals, and messages. And even if you're not a big of fan of REM's standard stuff, the diversity of the album's tracks should provide a breath of fresh air, and I think there's something here for everyone.<BR> <BR>DRIVE: A slow, hautning rock track with good vocals and guitars.<BR>TRY NOT TO BREATHE: I like the pacing and tempo of this song. The vocals are very well done, especially the chorus with interrwining lyrics.        <BR>THE SIDEWINDER SLEEPS TONITE: A peppy, upbeat pop track with catchy lyrics.<BR>EVERYBODY HURTS: A quiet but deeply moving ballad with outstanding vocals and guitars<BR>NEW ORLEANS INSTRUMENTAL NO. 1: A calm, peaceful instrumental track     <BR>SWEETNESS FOLLOWS: Another slow track with great background guitars and good vocals<BR>MONTY GOT A RAW DEAL: I love this song. The drums are awesome, the guitar riff in the chorus is very well done, and the vocals are heartfelt.<BR>IGNORELAND: A politically-charged emotional chant by Michael Stipe. I think it's a nice foil to the bevy of slow songs in the record, and the song is very energizing and meaningful.<BR>STAR ME KITTEN: Slow and brooding, with relaxing guitars and vocals.<BR>MAN ON THE MOON: An excellent alternative rock track with memorable lyrics and great guitar work.<BR>NIGHTSWIMMING: I remember hearing this song on the radio when I was about 5. It's a magnificent song with a very moving, melancholy sound and fantastic strings.<BR>FIND THE RIVER: A calming, upbeat closer with more talented vocals.

B000005HLV|4.0|With the murder of Mayhem's guitarist Euronymous (by Burzum mastermind Varg Vickernes, a session bassist on this album), the suicide of the ironically named vocalist Dead before the recording of this album, the Satanic and Pagan (as if the two somehow go together) beliefs of the band members and any other source of controversy that I haven't covered, Mayhem are certainly a well-known band in the black metal genre. Their antics are arguably more well-known and definately more widely discussed than their music. Because of this, one could be forgiven for being rather sceptical about them - are they famous for being one of the greats or are they famous because one of them made a necklace out of the other one's brains?<br />Well, De Mysteriis Dom Sathanas is certainly no wet lettuce. For anyone to listen to this and say that its nothing more than hype is simply wrong, since there's a lot of good stuff going on here. While the guitar parts are very simple, there is an atmosphere here that is very hard to describe, while the speed driven drums add pure intensity into the mix. Euronymous may not be able to shred it up, but he often does some slower solos here when its time for the band to stop blasting along like the Eurostar, and he does a good job.<br /><br />However, to say that the music here is incredible would be a lie. Much of the time it is simply blast blast blast, and contrary to popular belief there is more to black metal than that. There the occasional slower passages (not quiet passages, mind), but most of the time this band is plagued by a need for speed. This wouldn't be a problem if they were a technical death metal band, but they're not. Fast heavy music gets boring quickly when its this simple. Also, I'm going to have to agree with those who don't like Atilla. At times he can actually be quite good, but he almost seems microphone shy, as if he doesn't want to really let rip. The result is a cross between a teenager's voice breaking and a wet fart most of the time, which unsurprisingly detracts from the overall feel of the album and even sounds like a black metal parody.<br />It has to be said that musically, this album has since been bettered. Other bands have been more inventive, more atmospheric, more technically adept, more emotional and/or more professional. There's no question that this album is legendary in it's own right, but despite its reputation I'd have to recommend that you save it for when you're already into black metal. 4 stars nonetheless, but if you think this is all black metal has to offer then you're missing out on some much more creative music.time, which unsurprisingly detracts from the overall feel of the album and even sounds like a black metal parody.<br />It has to be said that musically, this album has since been bettered. Other bands have been more inventive, more atmospheric, more technically adept, more emotional and/or more professional. There's no question that this album is legendary in it's own right, but despite its reputation I'd have to recommend that you save it for when you're already into black metal. 4 stars nonetheless, but if you think this is all black metal has to offer then you're missing out on some much more creative music.
